website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch tool from a company with an excellent reputation for quality. You get a lot for your money.
pros: Speed range is a versatile 16,000 - 27,000 rpm
Smooth tool with excellent depth control

customer_reviews.title: Tends to melt parts.
customer_reviews.text: While it is a great router for small projects, I wouldn't run it for extended periods of time. It will get hot and melt parts. The one I bought melted a rubber bushing, and destroyed a brush. I did some research after the fact and found out that this router is notorious for burning out brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am dewalt tool fan, so I expected this router to work for quite a long time. I was only able to use it once! I came back to another project 3 months later and he motor bogged down and had inconsistent speeds. I was able to get it to work for the project. 2 weeks later went to use it, it spins up at its highest rpm then 3 seconds later motor stops turning. I turn it off and on and it will spin then stop
customer_reviews.author: TJ Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly, good router when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: After only half a dozen uses in soft wood and epoxy the router has stopped working. It turns on and spins at full speed for 2-3 seconds then makes a click noise as if a fuse inside tripped and the router slows to a crawl (~1 rotation per 5 seconds). The brushes inside are still like new and I couldn't see anything else wrong. I have purchased a new one hoping this was just a lemon as I love DeWalt tools... We will see. When it did work, it was exactly as advertised. Powerful, simple, compact.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Step up from the $99 ones- and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the cheap $99 Rigid one I had bought... this one is so much better. Works and feels like a real power tool not a child's toy like the tiny cheaper ones do. Has good power to cut through some hardwood I was working on... but probably best suited for softer wood if your a perfectionist as there was some kickback when it hit some knots in the hardwood. Overall good for the price, and a definite upgrade to the Rigid one I had
customer_reviews.author: ErinE

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Design
customer_reviews.text: Put a router bit into the shaft and it got stuck. Nothing is working and the bit appears to be fully stuck in there. I think it is a faulty design
customer_reviews.author: Christie Bucklin

customer_reviews.title: Round plate that accepts template guides not included.
customer_reviews.text: Came with torque cracks in the D plate at the screws. Three in all. DeWalt used to have good quality control. Guess they laid those people off? The tool itself is great though. Most of the power tools I own are DeWalt because of their "usual" quality. And as a number of other people pointed out; it is supposed to be a kit. So why not include a round plate that accepts template guides? Guess it's a matter of the bottom line. Why include a 1.00 piece of plastic when you can charge separately for 10 bucks. Right?
customer_reviews.author: Mikey D

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Great compact router. Plenty of grunt for basic edge treatments and small/medium sized jobs. LED lights are nice. Plunge base is smooth and easy to adjust. Variable speed is not strictly necessary but it's nice to have the option. My unit was a little dirty and the D-base was a little more scuffed up out of the box than I would have liked. I am probably going to put it in a small custom router table. Most of the negative reviews are from people who did not read the product description(regarding shank size) or are unwilling to learn how to use a router. With a few probably having genuinely defective/damaged units.
customer_reviews.author: Sup

customer_reviews.title: First time using a plunge router and they are amazing. I love the lights that shine on your ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade from my craftsman router! First time using a plunge router and they are amazing. I love the lights that shine on your work piece one of those simple things that makes life easier. It is really quick to switch out the bases on this router and there is a reason why Dewalt it so well known! I have yet to find a complaint about any product i have tried from them! The variable speed is another thing ive never had in a past router and it definitely comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Router failed within 2 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: The beginning the router worked fine routering edges on 1/2' Pine and cutting laminate. While using on the pine board it started to heat up to my amazement. I turned it off to let it cool down and now when I turn it on - it starts up fine and runs for maybe 15 seconds then cuts off. My mistake was waiting a month to use it after buying from Amazon, used it the day after the return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: Thad

customer_reviews.title: It's a very handy size for a hand-held router, ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a very handy size for a hand-held router, and powerful enough for the jobs it's used for. I bought the dust-collection accessories here as well,and they do a reasonable job of sucking up the dust. Still, with the way routers are, you always get dust that won't get collected, so wear a mask and protective glasses.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Go rout something!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few routers dating from the 70's or 80's including the best one I had, a Porter Cable plunge router. But I wanted a smaller one and decided on this one. Wow, I love this router, nice features, feels good in hand, does a great job and has a nice purr, rather than a really high-pitched whine. I bought the edge guide and that is perfect too. Easy to put on and adjust. I think you will like this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Bad review
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice, it doesn't work, very poor product, very bad
customer_reviews.author: cynthiaxinxin

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this Dewalt DWP611PK
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this Dewalt DWP611PK. It arrived on time and in good condition. It was purchased to compliment a variety of other routers in a small wood working shop, to fill a gap between small trim type routers and larger plunge routers. It is my opinion that it is equal in useful power as the larger routers. I use Frued, MLCS, Porter Cable, Bosch, Hitachi and now Dewalt. The DWP611PK plunge in my opinion works the smoothest. I like the smaller but solid feel. It was chosen for routing wooden signs with plastic letter template and it does that task exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Allen J. Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but the instructions are horrible.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice trim router. Has all the features I was looking for and plenty of power, so no complaints there. My only real complaint is that the manual is this huge folding sheet which is impossible to fold back correctly, is hard to handle and is hard to follow. For a power tool costing over $100 would of been nice to spend the extra $0.35 to have a proper instruction booklet. Also, it would of been nice if the quick release handles were properly tightened at the factory so that the depth didn't change on me the first time I used it. Maybe the directions said to verify that before use, but never got that far.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Turner

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about buying a compact router and am so glad I did. I do not have any complaints at all about this router, but if purchasing again I might consider the bosch version as they have a few additional accessories. I have not needed those yet, so it may never be an issue. I'm very happy with the dewalt 611. I've used both bases and no complaints about either.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately can't say much for long term durability, but my initial impression/use is that this is a high quality tool. 1. Smooth operation. Very little vibration at all speeds 2. Variable speed - AWESOME! Don't have to run it at ~30k rpm if I don't need to, resulting in quieter operation. 3. LEDs to increase visibility of what you're doing 4. Easy to adjust and locks in stably 5. Plunge base operation is smooth and has no slop/play Cons: None yet!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Super versatile smaller router
customer_reviews.text: I have two larger Dewalt routers that have served me well. One permanently mounted in my router table and one with the various bases for general use. This little router is a wonder and now my most often used router. So much more than a laminate trimmer, it's perfect for inlay work and just about anywhere a quarter inch shanked bit might be useful. I love the soft-start feature and that it seems much more powerful than one would imagine. It's so easy to handle that it improves accuracy in many situations. Changing to the plunge base takes seconds and is as sturdy and accurate as Dewalt's bigger plunge bases. It also takes standard router bushings. What's not to love!
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: First router ever! Easy to learn!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I have to say that this is one of the coolest tools that I have acquired. I am not a professional woodworker by any stretch of the imagination, but I do like trying new things and seeing positive results. Prior to purchasing this, I don't think I have ever used a router. Any routing experience I had was from watching someone else either live or on YouTube. After many reviews I decided to buy this one because reviews are important to me. This machine does so much for the price and learning on it was a pleasure. You will not be disappointed with this router.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Wish it came with a case
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavy, so it must be good. I just received this item today and haven’t used it yet... I’ll put some miles on it by the end of the week. Seems like a quality product. My one complaint is the storage bag... I wasn’t expecting a bag or a case or anything so I shouldn’t complain.... but these bags or horrible... how much more could it possibly cost for a plastic case? I’d pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Orange

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great however sometimes just loosening the locking clip makes the router bit drop down slightly instead of keeping it were it was and using the black wheel to lower it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this router, powerful and balanced
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorites tools. This is primarily a hand operated router. it can be mounted in many table but since it is a compact unit, designed for 1/4 inch shank, its main purpose is hand operation. it is surprisingly well balanced. No vibrations, quite silent, it has never bog on me it just work. It is quite well designed, high quality tool and it can be seen in every inch of this tool. Solid machine aluminum body, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: rubcapgarTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Plunge depth lock doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I have only used this one time, so it may improve with additional practice. But, the depth lock for plunging didn't lock at the depth i.e. it kept slipping and going deeper than what was intended.
customer_reviews.author: Knotty Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a round sub base for the plunge base
customer_reviews.text: I am an advocate of DeWalt tools. I have a couple of fixed base routers but no plunge router. To make the juice groove for cutting boards I decided to get the DWP611 combo. OK but a round sub base would make it easier to use the cutting guide I made. There is a base (DWP613) for the fixed base but it won’t fit the plunge base. Still searching for a round sub base for the plunge base.
customer_reviews.author: toledobill

customer_reviews.title: **UPDATE**😠
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE: Router internal has been getting extremely hot within about 5-10 minutes of normal use. It worked great the first several uses. It has been kept clean and used properly but now it overheats. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Rougarou Review

customer_reviews.title: built in light!!
customer_reviews.text: They got this one right. It has 2 built in lights in the base of the router. I have owned probably 10 or 15 routers in my career and this one is sweetest, no doubt about it. Porter Cable, Makita, Royobi, Hitachi, all have not thought to put a built in light on the routers I have owned. This is a nice router and fit the hand nicely too.
customer_reviews.author: john bliven

customer_reviews.title: In the end it was the LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth for days between the less expensive Makita palm router and this Dewalt. Love both brands and told myself I didn't need the LEDs. Next thing I know, they're the same price! Apparently I needed the lights more than I thought. :) Smooth little machine and the LEDs really do help. Love the micro adjuster, too!
customer_reviews.author: Pipes

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE ROUTER
customer_reviews.text: I have used it on several projects and love the size and performance. Plenty of os power. I love the non-movement start-up. The only negative is the adjusting for depth cut. It is a little awkward to make micro-adjustments. I do recommend this over the other routers in this class. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Must for woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Variable speed, plunge router base, fixed base, light weight, comes with a bag and all. Love it. Already used it to make some dovetail joints, can't wait to see what else I can do with it.
customer_reviews.author: WyomingDad

customer_reviews.title: Great little router.
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. Quiet and powerful with very little runout (.125" straight bit measured .126" in hard maple). I've used this to round over edges and cut grooves for inlay work. Where this router really shines is the LED lights in the base. The added lighting helps my aging eyes pick up lines for my inlay work and cutting mortises for small box hinges.
customer_reviews.author: TimG45Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Gets a lot of jobs done for cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these- one mounted in my X-carve CNC and the other for freehand work/backup. I've had the mounted one carving for hundreds of hours through wood and aluminum. It's a champ. I have not had problems like some other users reported (melted plastic bushings) but I keep the speed setting at 1-2 and don't push it too hard. If I had a failure, I'd install the backup one and take the original apart and fix it for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router, cheap screws.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for trim, moulding, laminates, and plys... but don't expect it to wrangle thicker hardwoods - going to need a 'real' router for that. The design and quality is typical dewalt, though I did experience the cheap mounting screws for an edge guide stripping after a single use. The plunge base is actually really nice and works very well. -1 star for cheap screws. Seriously dewalt? Quit using crappy aluminum screws.
customer_reviews.author: d_rek

customer_reviews.title: Great small router
customer_reviews.text: The soft start and smaller motor make this much easier to handle than the full sized versions. It has performed well so far, and if it is like my other Dewalt products, should continue to do so for years to come. Works fine when attached to my sign making jig, and is easy to free-hand with as well. The plunge base is easy to operated with one hand. The bits are easy to change out. It's about as good as a compact router can get.
customer_reviews.author: 1836Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I used a bosch full size router and Colt compact router for over 10 year, and was never happy with either. After reading some reviews I purchased this unit, and could not have been happier. At the first glance it is light and ergonomic. When you turn it on, its quiet, smooth and powerful. The quality of cut is smooth and clean even with low to mid quality bits. I have a larger 20 year old PC router in a dedicated router table, but I do not use it as much anymore. I highly recommend this unit. Downside: Does not come with a 1/2 inch collet or any type of guide. But I new that before purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Mehran Hossaini

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research I picked this compact router and I am happy that I did. I have only used it a couple times so far and I really like the design and quality of this router. It performed well cutting a juice groove in maple and walnut cutting boards and rounding edges on softer woods.
customer_reviews.author: MuffinMan

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 full sized routers but wanted something smaller and quick to set up. I was NOT disappointed in this router. Quick, accurate setup and very powerful! I would recommend this router to anyone, very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice when it comes to a router but it worked great for me. No complaints. I can see why there are so many 5 star reviews. Fast and easy to remove collar to change out bits. I own many Dewalt products, I think they are more reliable and built better than others.
customer_reviews.author: randy a davis

customer_reviews.title: Yes Sir
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for a few months and doing a couple awesome projects, I love this router! It's easy to use in both configurations. The smooth start motor makes it more comfortable. Variable speed adjustment helps keep the cuts clean. If you need a beginners router, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy to say it lives up to its reputation
customer_reviews.text: I researched routers before buying this one as it was the top rated one. I'm happy to say it lives up to its reputation. Lightweight, nimble, plenty of power, excellent control of every cutting aspect, illuminated work surface... I have a 1/2-inch big router (usually mounted to the table), but this one is great for hand routing jobs. You won't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie G Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Nice package with plunge base
customer_reviews.text: Excellent micro adjustment ring. This product is nearly identical to the Porter Cable, but this has a better included square sided base and better kits and accessories available. This thing has plenty of power to use as a replacement for a larger router as long as you don't need 1/2" bits. It's overkill for a laminate trim router, but the extra power is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Vandussen

customer_reviews.title: a great/versatile router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router. The addition of the plunge base adds so much functionality that It replaces 75% of the tasks associated with a normal plunge router. All the controls and adjustments are easy to use and feel very precise and secure. Swapping between fixed and plunge bases is super easy. Overall, the tool feels very solidly built. Soft start motor is very nice touch, plus its variable speed. I've been very impressed with the performance of the tool on a number tasks including: routing inlay, hinge mortises, profiling with a small round-over bit and cutting mortises. Great tool. If your on the fence about it, get it, its a totally worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I already own a full size router but wanted something for the smaller projects. This package is a tremendous deal. When you add the cost of the router and plunger from anywhere else you'll see how good of a deal this is. The router works great and I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t believe I didn’t buy this earlier.
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing. Makes Harbor freight one look like a paper weight. It’s slow startup allows for better control and the wood contouring is short of magical compared to my previous paperweight which gouged wood a lot. Would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Cerro

customer_reviews.title: Best Compact Router
customer_reviews.text: So there I was, routing an edge of a sign I just carved with my new router, with a smile on my face. This worked great for details and edging. I added the dust collection for this router and barely had anything left on the table to clean up when I was finished. Dust was not floating in the air. This thing is powerful for the size. Easy to switch out from fixed base to plunge base. Easy to adjust for depth of cut. Well made and easy to use. Great instructions. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave McGheeTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Very nice router
customer_reviews.text: Using this router to "carve" wooden signs and plaques. It is easy to control and adjust and is very safe to handle. Put my big Bosch in the router table and use this little guy for just about everything else. Heavy and extended use and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to speed up a recent re-model where replaced 9 (old Luan) doors with solid six panel wood doors. In addition to the milescraft templete kit, I also bought their top bearing router bit. All of this was used on this Dewalt palm router with the Dewalt pilot guide in the base (purchased separately) of the router. After careful measurement and marking the new doors setting the mortise jig took a little time but the actual mortising/routing was very fast and accurate. I recommend it as it is a whole lot lighter than my full size router, easier to handle and use especially in the horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easily recommend
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these units which are used in both my shop and on location. Had for years the older Bosch product which was good but lacked the LED light. Really, this has become one of my favorite tools for any number of reasons and I can easily recommend it in terms of both reliability and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been replacing all of his tools with Dewalt tools because of the quality and durability. He's used it so far to rout the edges of outside side tables he made for me. The tables look finished because of the routing.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice router, very few problems!
customer_reviews.text: Great for small projects. I work at home and only have to do short small projects. I have heard the complaints about bigger projects for its price this router is a deal! I haven't had much problems with it, the only thing I had to wait on was the router bits arriving 7 days after I ordered my router. Talk about having a remote control race car without the batteries!
customer_reviews.author: vantha

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I have mostly Bosch tools and have become a Bosch fanboy after I bought a bunch of their cordless tools. I also have a Bosch router attached to my Bosch router table. My first fanboy choice was to buy a Bosch replacement edge router after my ancient Porter Cable router died. I came across this Dewalt router and saw the great reviews. I liked the fact the there are two LED lights, which really helps freehand routing. The extra HP I thought was nice too. I've only used this without the plunger a couple of times but and I really like the soft start, which the better routers have.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: My favorite router ever.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is one of the best investments I've made in my shop. You can do so much with it. It's surprisingly powerful yet very easy to control. Perfect for anything from small roundovers to precise inlays to template work. I regularly use to with a flush trim bit and templates to make through-mortises in 1" thick stock. Super quick to change bits with the single-wrench system. Bit height adjustment is also a breeze. I'ma marry this router.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stager

customer_reviews.title: Great router combo for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This router combo kit is awesome! It has all the power I need to cut mortises with the plunge router and it's light enough to use one handed in the trim router base. I'll put it to you this way: I went to Popular Woodworking's Woodworking in America a few weeks back and in his class about cutting joinery with power tools, this is the router than Glen Huey was using. If it's good enough for the managing editor of Popular Woodworking to trust it in front of a crowd, it's good enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a set of six bookshelves and used this router for the dados. Works great. Get good blades, though. The engine has plenty of power but the cuts with a cheap blade aren't worthy of this great tool. Very happy with it - nice and solid. Thanks, DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: David The Good

customer_reviews.title: No router table available.
customer_reviews.text: There is no router table for this router and it will not fit any universal table. If you’re fine with that then buy it. As for me, its useless.
customer_reviews.author: Rusted Barn

customer_reviews.title: I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. High quality at a great price. I keep the plunger base attached to my router table and slide the router body in when I need to. Otherwise I find myself reaching for the compact router, which feels great and can even be used comfortably one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas DriscollTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: My favorite router!
customer_reviews.text: Love this router. It's more powerful than my fun little trim routers but lighter and more versatile than my big ole 3hp router. This could meet all your routing needs in a small shop
customer_reviews.author: Hubiewan

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally like dewalt but it’s the best little router there is. Only because Milwaukee doesn’t make one. And porter cables is light years behind.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH SCHOLTZ

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I can see how some might think this is under powered and you might be right if you need industrial power. If you want to trim, route and build wood items, look not further. I really like this router.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Happy Joy joy

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! Small, lightweight, powerful, the led lights make it easy to see what you're doing, I don't have any complaints. Only thing to keep in mind is that this is more of a second router and probably not the only one you want to have. I say that because it's a lot more difficult to find 1/4" bits than 1/2" shank (which do not fit on this router). Having said that, this model has plenty of power and torque, and is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ben McNabb

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Little Router by DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a smaller router for the wood shop and this fit the bill perfectly. Another great product by DeWalt. I already had purchased the larger brother to this router, which I also love. However, this one is better for ease of operation on smaller projects, such as rounding edges or making rabbets in a hurry. The plunge adapter works flawlessly. This router was reviewed in Wood Craft magazine and received the highest rating. Well worth the investment & highly recommended. Make sure you read & follow the manufacturer's recommendations & always wear hearing, eye, and dust protection when woodworking, but you already knew that!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Steven L. DC

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT Router Fixed/Plunge Base Kit, Variable Speed 1.25-HP Max Torque
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my husband. Can you say "BIG HIT!!!" He can't quit using it. Says "Works 10x better than his old one".
customer_reviews.author: Stacy P

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt never lets me down, did the research and this bad boy came out on top. Love the versatile and feels great when using.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Good Router!
customer_reviews.text: Everything Dewalt makes it top notch, and this router is no different. Having this model and the larger full size router myself, we bought this one as a gift for my father-in-law. He has had a good experience with it, same as I have. The smaller size seems perfect for everything that does not involve using the router table.
customer_reviews.author: zoiberg137

customer_reviews.title: Not your Daddy's router
customer_reviews.text: LED is great and one reason I bought this slightly underpowered router. The plunge kit was a good value, but make sure you need the application if you're going to go with this small router. Take it slow, you should be fine. Unfortunately Dewalt has seen their quality slip in some simple areas; horrible operating instructions (unclear and poorly printed) and an undersized/poorly fitting soft bag...at these prices, you'd expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Wow, What a Great Trim Router
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of inlay work, and this little beauty makes it so much easier and comfortable. Sure wish I'd bought this a couple years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Great router, but missing part.
customer_reviews.text: The locking clamp for the plunge attachment was not assembled and the lock ring was not on the package. I would've returned it, but needed it for an immediate project. I won't be able to use the plunge attachment until I track down a replacement for the missing part, which is very frustrating. The router itself works great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: A Great Router
customer_reviews.text: What a great router! I haven't used the router base yet, but I have used the fixed base. The router motor separates simply from each of the two bases and slides back in just as simply. It is easy to adjust the depth of cut very precisely within 1/64". The router has a professional-quality feel to it. The only thing I don't like is that the on-off rocker switch is small and covered by a rubber dust shield, which makes it impossible to operate while wearing thick gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mountains

customer_reviews.title: Built a guitar with it!
customer_reviews.text: It's everything I needed in a router. I know it's just a palm router, but I cut out an entire guitar with it plus built templates, planed joints, did very precise cuts, and gutted hoards of wood out of thick slabs and it never noticed. I love how fast it is to swap bases and bits. The LED lights are a huge plus! This is a quality piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.author: Platinumbackline

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: cant go wrong with dewalt. love there tools. i use for routing door hinges works perfect with ryobi door hinge jig. lightweight. powerful easy to handle
customer_reviews.author: J7470ek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised is 7 amps which is the most powerful compact router I have seen is well priced and is quiet and very smooth when cutting. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: They all work fine but I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I have three routers. They all work fine but I love this router. Any novice can use it immediately and get good results. Its easy to hold and the plunge makes inlay work smoothly. Now if I could find an inlay template guide with a removable bushing to fit it I would be in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Fodi

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this kit for a few years and very happy with it. I'm a contractor, and use this tool for work. I also have a very large router, but find that I reach for this one pretty much all the time. Its intuitive controls and light weight (small size) make it pretty easy to use. I am comfortable holding it with one hand. I purchased it to trim laminate counter tops, but find it competent for pretty all my hand routing needs.
customer_reviews.author: JAZman128

customer_reviews.title: This is a good router and the kit has everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller router with a plunge base for an inlay project. This is a good router and the kit has everything I needed. Worked well, arrived on time and am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: bailey

customer_reviews.title: great and versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. Although is not meant to be installed as a table router, but to be used with your hands. As is fit well my purposes and is powerful enough for the jobs I imtended. Really like the base and ease to change bits. If you add a guide you will be able to do more precise jobs. Is unfortunate that the tool does not come with this attachement as I funded very useful and necessary. Overal I gave 5 stars as I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Cervantino

customer_reviews.title: World's easiest router to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest and flexible router to use for any beginner amateur. I never used a router but I unboxed it and plugged in my 3/8" round over router bit and within 5 minutes I was routing my 1st board. It came out better than I anticipated and I was extremely easy to use. If I can do it, anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: You can never go wrong with DeWalt power tools
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy! Very well built, very rugged, and small case design makes it very ergonomic to work with.
customer_reviews.author: TheProgressiveRedneck

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. I love the soft start and variable speed. I am able to do things with this tool that a couldn't do with my big old 1-1/2 hp Rockwell router without giving up the power.The LED under light makes working in a poorly lit area easy. I read reviews about the switch cover making it difficult to turn on and off, and I see what they are saying, but it isn't enough to give a bad rating to a great tool. I'm over it after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Jershky

customer_reviews.title: two bases, solid router versitle and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product made even better as it has two bases giving you options. I have a HUGH plung router that will cut panels but heavy. This had no problem doing 3/4" 45 degree cuts as well as template cutting. .
customer_reviews.author: Mitch - B

customer_reviews.title: Ruined Christmas surprise
customer_reviews.text: The box was delivered in the original dewalt box and totally ruined surprising my husband for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Jonell Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Good price, junk router
customer_reviews.text: Good price thru Amazon, however, the router itself is crap. Bought for a table so I could build my cabinets. Used it for 2 months and the router is toast. The motor is bad, was throwing sparks out of it and almost caught the sawdust on fire. Not impressed and not the quality I would expect from Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My go to router.
customer_reviews.text: I have over a dozen routers. This one is my new favorite. I am very happy about my recent purchase. The router handles exceptionally well, and the led lights allow me to see what I am routing. The lever on the plunge base works very well. I feel very comfortable using this router, and my work has been better because of it. Base and bit changes are quick and easy. This is a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: T. Carstensen

customer_reviews.title: you get a router that is lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Though the you trade off power, you get a router that is lightweight and easy to use. Had tried the larger Dewalt but it was way too heavy for the small pieces I was using it for so I returned and got this one instead.
customer_reviews.author: peazley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little router, originally bought a orange trim rtr from HD but promptly returned when I realized it came with NO accessories and they emailed me with No plans to expand capabilities. Got it with the Plunge base and edge guide. Doesn't like my 3/4 rabbit bit (too much bite, material removal for one deep pass - maybe that's too much for any but this has the most hp in its class) does edges Very nicely. Smooth operation. I built it into a table for bits without bearings. Not recommended for large material takeout.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Oooh, this router works very well!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first router. I purchased it to use with a door hinge router kit (the porter cable one on amazon). It performed flawlessly. I have to admit, I'm the idiot that reads the manual and wears safety glasses so if you're one of those people who lives on the edge and doesn't care about safety or instructions, you might have different results with this router.
customer_reviews.author: r3t1awr3yd

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: I have several routers and needed a nice trim router to use on a rocking horse I was making for the grandkids. I read the reviews and they are very good; make sure you look at the video ones. These guys know what they are talking about. I just wanted everyone to know that this is very easy on the hands and not tiring to use like some of the others. I have some bigger ones, but this does what it is intended to do. So, if you need a smaller router, don't hesitate to get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Use for general woodworking. Heavier than I thought it would be which most people will Like.
customer_reviews.author: fern kiec

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that it can get into tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Wow, plenty of power and very versatile. I wish I have bought one years ago. I like the fact that it can get into tight spaces, the plunger adapter is a nice add on with easily adjustable stop.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G. Leblanc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this router freehand and find it easy to control with my medium sized hands. Visibility of the bit is good and the bright LED allows a pattern line to be clearly seen while routing. Bit changes are done with a collet lock and one wrench. And the depth of cut can be finely controlled by rotating a collar. The soft start is also a nice feature. Overall this router has a nice feel in use and I would buy it again. I have not used the plunge base yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Pacanowski

customer_reviews.title: Never used a router but love it
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a router but love this thing. I haven't had any issues using it to route edges and on my router sled. If you've never used a router, i would definitely go for it. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt palm router
customer_reviews.text: Was not ready for the dust to come out of this thing. Bought the optional dust collector attachment and tube to hook to my shopvac. Recommended. My son and I are building a telecaster guitar and I used the router to route holes for the pickups. Very satisfied with the performance of the router. It cut through the wood nicely.
customer_reviews.author: User in US

customer_reviews.title: LED, Plunge, Power, I like!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent router combo. I replaced a Bosch Colt with this setup and I am glad that I did. The LED is bright, the router is comfortable and the plunge base is an added bonus. The soft case is a nice touch as it allows you to add other accessories for transportation. I am not a fan of molded plastic cases, as they take up lots of space. An excellent palm router combination. Get one, and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Stickney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact Router
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this setup. Excellent compact router with plenty of power. Plunge base is silky smooth.
customer_reviews.author: B16borangecx

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: I can't find anything bad to say about this router. So glad I purchased it. Use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing powerful light little router.
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt hit one out of the park with this gem of a router. Duel LED lights on the bottom are a dream come true. The feel and heft while lighter than the larger cousin the 618, these are clearly quality tools that deserve a space in any woodworker's shop. I use them all the time. Mortising, round overs, chamfers, dados, etc. Mighty impressed with this router set.
customer_reviews.author: wickedgood

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: After comparing prices for this same item at Lowe's we gave Amazon a shot. Best router I'll every buy.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Gann

customer_reviews.title: Your getting your moneys'worth
customer_reviews.text: Handle like a dream. Cut 1" deep mortises in walnut and no problem at all. Great little router
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This plunge router works well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: big time reader

customer_reviews.title: A joy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So enjoy using this sturdy easy to adjust and operate router.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D McMillin

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought the handheld to do light work and inlay work and it is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and plenty powerful for small jobs. One small problem occurred when I assumed the depth stop clamp would hold the router at the set depth but vibration caused it to slip. I had to tighten the clamp with an allen wrench to snug it up and that was not clearly stated to check in the initial set up. Other than that, the router performed great and had plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: The router works great. There are some things that can be improved: the lighting is very low and the locking collar sometimes needs a little extra force
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Seal

product_meta.title: DEWALT Router Fixed/Plunge Base Kit, Variable Speed, 1.25-HP Max Torque (DWP611PK)
product_meta.description: Includes Premium Compact Router Fixed/Plunge Combo Kit - DWP611PK
feature_bullets: Durable 1.25 horsepower motor delivers the power to meet the toughest applications
Variable speed control feature enables bit speed to be optimized for changing applications. No Load Speed range 16,000-27,000rpm
Soft-starting motor features full-time electronic feedback that maintains motor speed through the cut
Dual LED's and clear sub-base ensure maximum visibility in operation
Adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes to within 1/64-inch (fixed base only)
Allows up to 1.5" of depth travel with standard base & 2" with plunge base.Adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes to within 1/64" (fixed base only)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,199 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
